block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around Westchester and Putnam Counties. Items for the guide may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance to Westchester Cultural Calender, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

CROTON FALLS -- Staged readings of ''Skylights'' by David Hare. Today at 4 p.m. ''The Unexpected Man'' by Yasmina Reza. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through July 30. Donation: $12 each. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road, off Route 22. (914) 277-8477.

ELMSFORD -- ''The Sound of Music.'' Show-only performances Wednesdays at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 2. Tickets: $30; children 16 and younger, with limit of two children accompanying each adult, $20. Sundays and Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6. Matinees Wednesdays and Thursdays at 1 p.m., with lunch at 11:30 a.m. and Sundays at 1:30 p.m., with lunch at noon. Tickets: $46 to $66. Through September. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival presents ''Measure for Measure.'' Today at 6 p.m., Thursday at 7 p.m. and next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through July 30. ''The Taming of the Shrew.'' Previews Wednesday at 7 p.m. and Friday at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 27. Tickets: $17 to $30, with discounts (except Saturday evenings) for students, people 65 and older and children. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

MAMARONECK -- ''The Mysterious Mr. Love.'' Today at 2 and 7 p.m., Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $20 and $24. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.

MONTROSE -- Hand to Mouth Players perform Neil Simon's ''Come Blow Your Horn.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $10; people 62 and older and children, $8. Theater of building 2, Veterans Affairs Hospital, Route 9A. (914) 734-4336.
NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Comedy of Errors.'' Tonight and Thursday through next Saturday at 8. Through July 30. Free. Grounds of Fleetwood Stage, 44 Wildcliff Drive. (914) 654-8533.
NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Macbeth.'' Tonight and next Friday and Saturday at 8. ''The Heiress.'' Wednesday and Thursday at 8 p.m. Through July 30. Tickets: $5. Iona College. (914) 633-2606.

YORKTOWN HEIGHTS -- The musical ''1776.'' Today at 3 p.m., next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $22; Yorktown residents, $20; students and people 62 and older, $18; children, $12. Yorktown Community Cultural Center, Veterans Road. (914) 962-0606.
Music and Dance

BREWSTER -- Doansburg Chamber Ensemble performing music by Hummel, Carl Stamitz and D. F. R. Kuhlau and the world premiere of Antony Paasch's ''Scherzo for Flute, Cello and Piano.'' Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $9; students and people 62 and older, $8. Trinity Lutheran Church. (845) 228-4167.

DOBBS FERRY -- Singer and songwriter, Blake Rowe, followed by the Wickers Creek Band. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (Rain location, Embassy Community Center, 60 Palisade Street.) (914) 631-1000.
EASTCHESTER -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Lawn of Eastchester Town Hall, Mill Road. (914) 723-7171.
GOLDENS BRIDGE -- Folk dancing led by Jim Gold. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Admission: $6. Goldens Bridge Community Center Barn, Hall Avenue. (914) 232-1862.

KATONAH -- Caramoor International Music Festival continues with Stewart Goodyear, pianist, performing works by Mozart, Lennon/ McCartney, Chopin and others. Thursday at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. All-Bach concert by St. Luke's Chamber Ensemble. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. Bellini's opera ''Il Pirata.'' Performed by Orchestra of St. Luke's, the Caramoor Festival Chorus; Will Crutchfield, conductor; Indra Thomas and Laura Danehower Whyte, sopranos; Francisco Almanza and Bruce Fowler, tenors; Daniel Mobbs, baritone, and Valeriano Lanchas, bass. Next Saturday at 8 p.m., with preconcert lecture at 7. Tickets: $30 to $75. Alica de Larrocha, pianist, performs works by Mozart, Schubert, Turina and others. Next Sunday at 4:30 p.m., with preconcert conversation at 3:30. Tickets: $25 and $35. Girdle Ridge Road. (914) 232-1252.
KATONAH -- Outdoor jazz concert by Jody Sandhaus and Pete Malinverni Trio. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Garden of Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.
MAMARONECK -- Blues by Big Chief and Midnight Groove. Tonight at 7. (Rain date, tomorrow.) Free. Harbor Island Park. (914) 777-7722.
NEW ROCHELLE -- The Capris. Presented by North Bronx/Westchester Neighborhood Restoration Association. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Hudson Park, Pelham Road. (718) 823-7704.

NYACK -- Neil Berg's ''Broadway in Concert.'' Broadway singers and dancers perform music from ''West Side Story,'' ''Phantom of the Opera,'' ''Rent'' and other shows. Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m.and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $40. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.

PAWLING -- Rod Piazza and Mighty Flyers. Tonight at 8. Eric Bogle. Friday at 9 p.m. Savoy Brown, featuring Kim Simmonds. Next Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $20 each; members, $17.50. Towne Crier, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.
PURCHASE -- Steel Passion, steel drum ensemble. Thursday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Rain or shine. In front of Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.

RIVERDALE -- Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company, with music by Korean percussion ensemble. Today at 5 p.m. and Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Grounds admission only: $4; students and people 62 and older, $2; children 5 and younger, free. Wave Hill, 675 West 249th Street and Independence Avenue. (718) 549-3200.
SCARSDALE -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Chase Park. (914) 723-7171.

SOMERS -- Outdoor jazz concert. Friday at noon. Free. (914) 232-9511. Vivaldi's ''Four Seasons'' by Philharmonia Virtuosi; Richard Kapp, music director. Next Saturday at 6 p.m. Tickets: $10; children 17 and younger, $3. (914) 693-5595. Lasdon Park, Route 35.

VALHALLA -- Salute to Duke Ellington, with organist and vocalist, Sarah McLawler, and her group Les Femmes Jazz and tap dancer, Tina Pratt. Next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and people 60 and older, $12; children, free. Student center lounge, Westchester Community College. (914) 785-6262.

WHITE PLAINS -- Marches, show tunes and classical and pop selections by White Plains Pops Band; Alfred A. Renino, director. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Turnure Park. (Rain location, Highlands Middle School.) (914) 422-1336.

YONKERS -- ''Legends and Fables'' with Tammy Lum, pianist, assisted by Patricia Sohn, pianist. Works by Grieg, Schubert, Mendelssohn and others. Today at 4 p.m. Marshall Field House, Sarah Lawrence College.

YONKERS -- Latin jazz by Eye Contact, led by bass player and composer, Harvie Swartz. Friday at 8 p.m. Admission: $10, with viewing of museum's exhibits and Glenview Mansion from 5 to 8 and planetarium show at 7; museum members, $5; children, free. Barbecue buffet and other refreshments available, beginning at 6. Rain or shine. Courtyard of Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 763-4550.

YONKERS -- Jazz by Billy Lester Trio. Next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $25, with reception after performance. Advance tickets: $20; people 65 and older and Friends of Philipse Manor Hall, $15. Philipse Manor Hall, Warburton Avenue and Dock Street. (914) 965-4027.
Films

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''The Freshman,'' silent film starring Harold Lloyd, with Jesse Beller's live musical accompaniment. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.
PEEKSKILL -- ''Adrenalin Drive,'' Japanese film with subtitles. Thursday and Friday at 8 p.m. Admission: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

SUFFERN -- ''Sugar Town.'' Part of independent film festival sponsored by Finkelstein Memorial Library. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Donation: $3; students and people 60 and older, $1. Rockland Community College. (845) 352-5700, ext. 243.
WHITE PLAINS -- ''The Dinner Game,'' French comedy with subtitles. Tomorrow at 2 and 7 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
Children

BEDFORD -- Full-moon walk in search of nocturnal creatures. Bring flashlights. Tonight at 8. Meet the bugs of Westmoreland, then join in a bug hunt outdoors. Program for all ages, with collecting jars and nets provided. Next Saturday at 11 a.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.
BEDFORD HILLS -- Outdoor concert by children's singer and entertainer, Graham Clarke. Thursday at 7:15 p.m. Free. Bedford Hills Memorial Park, Haines Road. (914) 666-7004.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''The Valiant Little Tailor,'' acting workshop presented by Singing Harp Players. For children 7 through 12. Next Saturday at 10 a.m. Registration. Followed by performance at 11:30 a.m. Both free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

GREENBURGH -- ''Critters, Crafts and Kids,'' children 18 months through 4 years and parents take part in program of stories, crafts and nature fun. Wednesdays from 10 to 11 a.m. Through July 26. Cost: $4 each; children, $3. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.

KATONAH -- Summer children's day, with 19th-century games and crafts, including kite making, ring toss and needle work. Presented by members of Jane Austen Society of New York. Admission: $3; children, $5. Refreshments and horse and cart rides available. John Jay Homestead, 400 Route 22. (914) 232-5651.

KATONAH -- ''Landscape With Watercolors,'' children 7 and older learn to paint large pictures outdoors. Wednesdays from 1 to 3 p.m. Cost: $15 each; members, $12. Registration. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

MOUNT VERNON -- Program of historic games, toys and songs for children 6 through 10. Tuesday from 10:30 to 11:15 a.m. Songs of the American Revolution. Wednesday from 12:15 to 1 p.m. ''St. Paul's and the Presidents,'' talk about Washington, Adams, Lincoln and F. D. R.'s association with St. Paul's. Thursday from 11 to 11:45 a.m. Church bell tower tour. Friday at 3 p.m. All free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

OSSINING -- Learn about the defenses animals use to escape predators or find a mate, from teeth and claws to horns and hooves. Next Saturday from 11 a.m. to noon. Cost: $6; members, $4. Registration. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

RYE -- Playland Park features amusement rides, Kiddyland, beach, swimming pool, boating and free entertainment. Sundays and Tuesdays through Thursdays from noon to 11 p.m. and Fridays and Saturdays from noon to midnight. Free fireworks. Wednesdays and Fridays at 9:15 p.m. Amusement rides require 3 to 5 tickets each. Ticket books: $8 for 12-ticket book; $15 for 24-ticket book and $19 for 36-ticket book. Free admission. Parking: $4 weekdays; $5 weekends. Exit 19 of I-95. (914) 925-2700.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- ''I Can Feel It in My Bones,'' storytelling program with Maxine Maxwell. Thursday at 7 p.m. Admission: $3; children, free. Hudson Valley Writers Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
SOMERS -- ''Butterflies at the Farm,'' nature walk and children's activities. Next Sunday from noon to 3 p.m. Free. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 232-7118.

SPRING VALLEY -- Chess workshops led by Armen Kherlopian. For children 7 and older in East Ramapo Central School District. Tomorrow, July 31 and Aug. 14 from 7 to 8:30 p.m. Free. Finkelstein Memorial Library, 24 Chestnut Street. (845) 352-5700.

TARRYTOWN -- Camp-out at Sunnyside. Next Saturday, arriving at 4:30 p.m. to set up tent. Followed by picnic dinner and joining others for watermelon and period games. At dusk campers join costumed guide for spooky flashlight walk, followed by storytelling around campfire. Coffee, juice and doughnuts provided for breakfast. Families bring all necessary camping gear and their picnic dinner. Cost: $35; children 3 through 17, $25. One adult required for every two children. Registration. (914) 631-8200, ext. 628.

WHITE PLAINS -- Children read and write poetry. Tuesday at 4 p.m. Storytelling program with Jonathan Kruk. For children 3 and older and their families. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1476.

YONKERS -- Lunch story time. Children 3 and older bring their lunch and listen to stories. Mondays (including tomorrow) at noon. Through July. Children 8 and 9 compete in the ''Zany Brainy Quiz Show.'' Tuesday at 11 a.m. Registration. Pajama story time. Children listen to stories and songs in their pajamas, carrying their teddy bears. Tuesdays at 6:30 p.m. Through July. All free. Will Library, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.

YONKERS -- Stories of river creatures and star legends by Jeani Miller. Today at 1:30 p.m. Cost: $1 and museum admission: $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. Sky shows: ''The Sky Tonight.'' Saturdays and Sundays at 1:30 p.m. ''Rusty Rocket's Last Blast.'' Saturdays and Sundays at 2:30 p.m. ''Guided by the Sky.'' Saturdays and Sundays at 3:30 p.m. Admission: $4 each; people 62 and older and children, $3. Museum admission and one sky show. Cost: $7; people 62 and older and children, $5. ''The Sky Tonight.'' Fridays at 7 p.m. Free tickets available at front desk beginning at 6:30. Visit the inside of a real 1930's tugboat and coffee barge. Next Sunday from noon to 5 p.m. Admission payable at boat: $2. J. F. K. Marina, below museum. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 763-4550; 24-hour recorded planetarium message (914) 963-2139.
Lectures

MAMARONECK -- ''Pre-Retirement Planning,'' lecture by Julian Block, author of ''Julian Block's Tax Avoidance Secrets.'' Sponsored by Center for Continuing Education. Friday at 8:30 a.m. $25. Registration required. Mamaroneck High School. (914) 698-3255.
Art
DOBBS FERRY -- ''Seasons,'' landscapes and cityscapes by Patrick Antonelle. Through Sept. 6. Forever Gallery, 60 Cedar Street. (914) 674-8035.

GREENBURGH -- ''Painting My Story,'' acrylic paintings by Jennifer A. L. Scharbach. Opening reception with refreshments, today from 2 to 4 p.m. Through Aug. 20. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $3; children, $2. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.

KATONAH -- ''Maine and the Modern Spirit,'' featuring works from the figurative to abstract by George Bellows, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Edward Hopper and 51 other artists. Opens today from 2 to 5 p.m. Through Sept. 24. ''Emily Feinstein: Sites Unseen,'' outdoor structures by artist. Through Oct. 1. Admission: $3; free for children. Members of Katonah Museum Artists Association show slides and discuss their recent works. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free of charge. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

LARCHMONT -- ''Art on a Clothesline,'' reasonably priced light and lively unframed art. Through July 26. Reception with refreshments, Thursday from 5:30 to 7 p.m. Mamaroneck Artists Guild, 2120 Boston Post Road. (914) 834-1117.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Sculpture, ceramics and paintings by members of the Hugh A. Doyle Senior Center. Through July. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.

NYACK -- ''Unique Perspectives -- The Figure and Narrative,'' paintings by Eva Marino, Seth Michael Foreman and Brian Jermusyk. Today and Thursday through next Sunday from 1 to 5 p.m. Donation: $1. Hopper House Art Center, 82 North Broadway. (845) 358-0774.

PEEKSKILL -- ''Monhegan Island: The 1950's and 1960's,'' watercolors by Bohdan Osyczka. Through Aug. 13. Reception next Saturday from 5 to 7 p.m. Flat Iron Gallery, 105 South Division Street. (914) 734-1894.

POCANTICO HILLS -- Guided tour of stained glass windows by Marc Chagall and Henri Matisse. Sundays from 2 to 5 p.m. and Mondays and Wednesdays through Saturdays from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $3. Union Church of Pocantico Hills, 555 Bedford Road. (914) 631-2069.
Potpourri

CARMEL -- Civil War encampment re-enactment, with parades, skirmishes, field hospital demonstrations, music and refreshments. Today from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m Admission: free. Putnam Veterans Memorial Park, Gipsey Trail Road. (845) 225-0381.

GARRISON -- Guided tours of Boscobel Restoration, 19th-century Federal-style home of States Morris Dyckman, Loyalist during the American Revolution. Daily except Tuesdays from 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m., with last tour beginning at 4:15. Admission: $8; people 60 and older, $7; children 6 through 13, $5; younger children, free. Grounds only pass: $5; children 6 through 13, $3. 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-3638.
HARTSDALE -- Irish American heritage celebration. Today from 1 to 7 p.m. Ridge Road Park. (914) 242-7275.

KATONAH -- House tours of John Jay Homestead. Wednesdays through Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Sundays from noon to 4 p.m., beginning every hour. Admission: $3; people 62 and older, $2; children, $1. Walking tour of grounds. Sundays, weather permitting, at 2:30 p.m. Free. 400 Jay Street, Route 22. (914) 232-5651.
KATONAH -- Alfresco lunch and tours of Caramoor's gardens. Tuesdays at noon. Through Aug. 15. Tickets: $25. Reservations. Girdle Ridge Road. (914) 232-1253.

NEW CITY -- ''Leaving Her Mark: Contributions of Rockland's Women,'' exhibition highlighting diversely talented Rockland County women from the 18th-century to present day. Tuesdays through Sundays from 1 to 5 p.m. Donation: $4, including free admission to Jacob Blauvelt House on Sundays; $3 for children. Through Sept. 10. Historical Society of Rockland County, 20 Zukor Road. (845) 634-9645.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Finals of Big Apple Classic. Today at 8 a.m. Grounds admission: $15. Wykagyl Country Club. (800) 444-5742.

NORTH SALEM -- Asian arts festival with Tibetan, Japanese and Indian dancers, koto drummers, Korean karate, demonstrations of origami, the Chinese tea ceremony and Chinese cooking and children creating their own kites and bamboo flutes. Today from 2 to 6 p.m. Admission: $10. Sale of crafts and refreshments. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, top of Deveau Road, off June Road. (914) 669-5033.

OSSINING -- Walk the trail that will soon link Teatown to the Old Croton Aqueduct, Briarcliff-Peekskill Trailway and Kitchawan Preserve. Next Saturday from 9:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Free. Reservations. Bring water and snack. Meet at nature center of Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

YONKERS -- Narrated ferry ride. Presented by New York Waterways in conjunction with Hudson River Museum. Wednesday from 12:30 to 2 p.m. Cost: $10; children, $7. Registration. Yonkers City Pier. (914) 963-4550, ext. 247.
